A **dwarvish spear** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [stackable](/wiki/Stackable "Stackable") one-handed weapon that uses the [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") and is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **stout spear** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [4.3 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

[Dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") characters start the game with knowledge of the dwarvish spear. Any dwarven character that would start the game with a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") will start with a dwarvish spear instead - currently, there are no applicable roles where this substitution occurs.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Dwarvish spears make up about 1.2% of randomly generated weapons. In addition to random generation, weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock dwarvish spears.

Non-[undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") that [are generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword") have an effective 1⁄4 chance of generating with a dwarvish spear.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a 3⁄290 chance (just above 1%) of being generated with a stack of 1-4 dwarvish spears as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Dwarven [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start the game with a +1 dwarvish spear, making use of the existing racial substitution.

## Strategy

The dwarvish spear is the strongest among spear weapons, dealing damage on par with a [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword") or a [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber") against non-[silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") haters - it is also the heaviest, weighing 5 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") more than a regular spear. [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") that happen upon a dwarvish spear can use it as a solid melee weapon, and can collect more to use as a [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot")-compatible projectile, though a stack of dwarvish spears can become heavy quickly.

## History

The dwarvish spear first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), dwarven [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") start the game with a +1 dwarvish spear.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), the [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") of [Dragonbane](/wiki/Dragonbane "Dragonbane") is changed from a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword") to a dwarvish spear. It has +d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +d4 damage, confers all dragon-based resistances while wielded, and has a 1⁄2 chance of instantly slaying any dragon it hits.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Dragonbane is a dwarvish spear as in SporkHack and behaves mostly the same, except that its instakill chance is reduced to 1⁄5, and wielding it also grants [warning of dragons](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the dwarvish spear deals d10 damage to all monsters, and its weight is lowered to 30 aum.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), a dwarvish spear can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a spear and 2 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"); a dwarvish spear can be combined with a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") to create a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), successfully [untrapping](/wiki/Untrap "Untrap") a [spear trap](/index.php?title=Spear_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spear trap (page does not exist)") has a chance of generating an intact dwarvish spear.

[Upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") a dwarvish spear will produce an [orcish spear](/wiki/Orcish_spear "Orcish spear"), and upgrading an [elven spear](/wiki/Elven_spear "Elven spear") will produce a dwarvish spear.

In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, a dwarvish spear can be combined with a [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail") to create an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 224](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L224): *Race-based substitutions for initial dwarf inventory*
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 378](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L378): *1⁄2 chance not to generate with a [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"), followed by 1⁄2 chance at a spear*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 275](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L275): *stackable weapons for player monsters*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [u\_init.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 343](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/u_init.c#line343 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/u init.c")
